title: FR-011: Use session-scoped points storage instead of localStorage
description:
Context: Points persist to localStorage, surviving browser restarts. FR-011 requires session-scoped points that reset on refresh.

Requirements:
- Points persist during single browser session
- Points reset when session ends (tabs closed)
- No localStorage for points/redeemed state

Acceptance:
- sessionStorage or in-memory session store
- New browser window starts at 0 points
- Same tab refresh retains points
- Closing all tabs resets points

title: FR-022: Visual Performance Safeguards
description:
**Goal:** App remains usable on low-performance devices
**Success Definition:** Heavy animations degrade gracefully
**Dependencies:** FR-021

## Scope
- Detect reduced motion preference
- Automatically downgrade: Confetti glitch intensity, 3D rotation depth, Continuous animations (pause when offscreen)
- Display subtle 'Performance Mode' indicator when active

## UI States
- **Loading:** Performance check message hidden
- **Error:** Manual 'Reduce Effects' toggle appears

## UAT
- Enable reduced motion in OS → Reload app → animations simplified
- **Negative:** Full effects remain on capable devices
- **Cross-Device:** Applies on mobile browsers

## Out of Scope
User-configurable quality presets

- No React state-update-on-unmounted-component warnings

**Implementation Notes:**
- Add cleanup function in useEffect return
- Store timeout ID in ref

**Test Plan:**
- Mount/unmount component rapidly
- Verify no console warnings

title: Prevent useCamera effect from restarting due to startCamera identity changes

**Why now:** P1 bug affecting user experience - camera view flickers/restarts.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Camera starts once and stays stable
- No unnecessary MediaStream recreation
- Effect only reruns when truly needed

**Implementation Notes:**
- Use `useCallback` for `startCamera` with stable dependencies
- Consider extracting camera init to ref-based pattern

**Test Plan:**
- Open camcorder screen
- Verify camera starts once without flicker
- Navigate away and back, verify clean restart

title: FR-024: Text Contrast & Readability Validation
description:
**Goal:** All text remains readable under visual overlays
**Success Definition:** WCAG 2.1 AA contrast met
**Dependencies:** FR-023

## Scope
- Validate text contrast against: CRT scanlines, Halftone noise
- Apply conditional background plates behind text if needed
- Preserve aesthetic while ensuring legibility

## UI States
- **Loading:** Contrast validation not user-visible
- **Error:** 'High Contrast Mode Enabled' badge

## UAT
- Inspect all screens
- Confirm text readable in bright/dim environments
- **Negative:** Overlays never obscure system messages
- **Cross-Device:** Mobile readability verified

## Out of Scope
Theme switching
close_reason: Completed text contrast validation and fixes. Added background plates behind chrome text elements across all screens (FlipPhone, SMS, Wallet, CakeSweeper, CDMix) to ensure WCAG 2.1 AA contrast compliance under global overlays (scanlines, noise). Enhanced camcorder viewfinder text contrast with dark backing plates for REC indicator, camera settings, and date/time display.

FR-025: Session Progress Indicator
description:
**Goal:** User understands where they are in the experience
**Success Definition:** Progress indicator updates across major milestones
**Dependencies:** FR-024

## Scope
- Add subtle progress UI (icons or dots)
- Milestones: Call answered, Gift revealed, Photo snapped, Charm collected, CD burned, Game played
- Indicator persists across routes

## UI States
- **Loading:** Placeholder dots
- **Error:** Indicator hides gracefully

## UAT
- Progress through app → Indicator updates correctly
- **Negative:** Skipped sections marked incomplete
- **Cross-Device:** Indicator unobtrusive on mobile

## Out of Scope
Percentage labels

title: Improve camera error classification using DOMException.name
description:
**Goal:** Improve camera error messages by classifying errors using `DOMException.name`

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- `NotAllowedError` → 'Camera permission denied'
- `NotFoundError` → 'No camera found'
- `NotReadableError` → 'Camera in use by another app'
- Generic fallback for unknown errors

**Implementation Notes:**
- Update `useCamera` hook error handling
- Map exception names to user-friendly messages

**Test Plan:**
- Deny camera permission → verify correct message
- Test on device without camera if possible

title: FR-027: Easter Egg Interactions
description:
**Goal:** Delight curious users with hidden interactions
**Success Definition:** Easter eggs trigger without blocking core flow
**Dependencies:** FR-026

## Scope
- Define at least 3 hidden triggers (e.g., long-press logo, secret key combo)
- Each Easter egg produces: Visual gag, Short message
- Easter eggs are optional and non-blocking

## UI States
- **Error:** Easter egg silently fails if unsupported

## UAT
- Trigger known Easter egg → Effect appears
- **Negative:** No accidental triggers
- **Cross-Device:** Long-press works on touch

## Out of Scope
Tracking egg discovery

title: Make localStorage access SSR/test-safe in CharmContext.tsx
description:
**Problem:** Crashes in SSR/test environments where window/localStorage unavailable, plus crashes on corrupted storage values.

**Solution:** Centralized storage access behind getItem/setItem helpers that return fallbacks when window undefined, wrap in try/catch, and JSON-parse safely with fallback on invalid JSON.

**Files Changed:**
- src/lib/storage.ts (SSR-safe guards + safe JSON handling)
- src/context/CharmContext.tsx (use storage helpers)
